result.execSummary:
The defendant Bruce L. Vossekuil was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence currently being served to include but not limited to Adams Co Case 05CF111 and Wood Co Case 05CF505.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision. In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
No contact with J. Rozner directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.
Any other terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by supervising agent.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence currently being served to include but not limited to Adams Co Case 05CF111 and Wood Co Case 05CF505.

Transcript of Plea/Sentencing Hearing - April 1, 2016

records.addlTxt: Information for Defendants After Felony Conviction - Warning not to Possess Firearms

Case called @ 1:46 p.m. Defendant Bruce L. Vossekuil in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Bruce L. Vossekuil in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The Court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC. Repeater enhancer DRI.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 15CM278 - DRI. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Szilagyi. No statement by DE. Court orders: 2 year term of imprisonment consecutive to any other sentence currently being served to include but not limited to Wood Co Case 05CF505 and Adams Co Case 05CF111 - Bifurcated SEH - 1 yr IC/ 1 yr ES - 256 days CFTS. ES Conditions: Any terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by supervising agent, NC w/ J. Rozner, Restitution in the amount of $200, Costs to be paid from up to 25% of inmate earnings during IC. Defendant is not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-01-2016 01:45 pm

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

15CF-39 and 15CM-278 - Both Cases Called @ 1:07 PM: Defendant Bruce L. Vossekuil in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  15CF-39:  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. Per SPD:  Eligibility confirmed.  DA argues as to bond -  global bond of $15000 Cash.  Jail staff confirmed prior to going of record that an ES hold is in place as to Portage Co case - status of probation needs to be confirmed.  New charges anticipated from Portage Co as well.  SPD has no position as to bond requested.  15CF-39 Court makes a Riverside Ruling in favor of State - probable cause for the offense alleged.  Orders $15000 cash bond with conditions.    15CM-278: Orders $10000 Cash Bond with same conditions ordered in companion case of 15CF-39.  IA scheduled as to both matters.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint as to both cases.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
